answers.answer: I don't know what line of work you're in, but I do know of some people with hcv have told their employers, only to be fired.  In one case, they said they fired her for the safety of other employees (she was an office worker, highly unlikely she'd infect anyone else); in another it appeared they were more concerend about the possibility of absences--possible, but they should have waited to see if that actually occurred.

You can get it only from blood to blood contact....I would suggest not to tell your employer. My doctor suggested i wear a tag, like diabetes etc use.  Only in case I'm in an accident and bleeding badly to protect others..Don't worry.  LIke I said above "take your time" and be selective who you tell...Deb  :)
